alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Labette (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 8:07PM CDT until May 09 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Neosho River at Oswego affecting Cherokee and Labette Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Neosho River at Oswego. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The left bank begins to overflow and floods agricultural fields. Also the dirt county road, 13000 Road, along the north side of the river bank starts to flood at 1.5 miles downstream of gage site where the bridge crosses Lightning Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.6 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Neosho River Oswego 17.0 17.5 Sun 8 pm CDT 9.4 7.8 8.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
